result.execSummary:
The defendant Colt M Lemmers was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Reckless Driving-Endanger Safety (2nd+), an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 346.62(2).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Contact Probation in Portage, WI by 4 pm today

miscConds.notes: Submit DNA Sample and pay surcharge

Complete an in-person Driver's Safety Program
Comply with and complete any and all counseling or treatment recommended by the Agent 
If after 12 months the defendant has paid the fine and costs in full and has had no criminal violations, the defendant may petition the court for Expungement 973.015.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Colt M Lemmers

records.addlTxt: Marquette County DNA Proof of Submission

2:28 PM Prosecuting attorney Clifford C. Burdon in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Colt M Lemmers in court.  Attorney Steven James Sarbacker in court for Colt M Lemmers. 
Atty Burdon states plea agreement.  Defendant to enter plea to Ct 3.  State will move to dismiss and read-in Cts 1 & 2. Atty Sarbacker agrees.
Court questions defendant regarding plea. Advises of Constitutional Rights and elements of the charge. Defendant enters No Contest plea to Ct 3.  Court questions Atty Sarbacker.  Court finds plea made knowingly, voluntarily & Intelligently. Court relies on the criminal complaint for a factual basis. BY THE COURT:  Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charges.  Court accepts defendant's plea and finds defendant guilty of Ct 3 and orders the judgment of conviction as of today's date.  Counts 1 & 2 are dismissed & read-in.
Counsel make sentencing statements.  Defendant makes statement.

BY THE COURT - Ct 3:  Sentence withheld, defendant placed on probation for a period of 12 months with conditions:
*Complete an in-person drivers safety program
*Treatment or counseling deemed appropriate by agent
*Pay $100.00 fine plus costs = $579.00
*Submit DNA sample
*Court grants expungement under 973.015 upon successful completion of all conditions

10:28 AM Prosecuting attorney Brian J. Juech appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Colt M Lemmers appeared by phone.  Attorney Steven James Sarbacker appeared by video for Colt M Lemmers. 
Atty Sarbacker states that he and the Defendant received a copy of the criminal complaint & waives it's reading. Court advises defendant of maximum penalties.  Defendant understands. 

Atty Sarbacker states that the defendant will waive time limits for the Prelim.  Defendant agrees.
BY THE COURT:  Defendant waives time limits for the preliminary hearing. 
bond continued
Status hearing scheduled for July 25, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Status hearing on July 25, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

on Petition to Appoint Atty
Emailed to Atty Sarbacker. MG

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant
Pet for appointment counsel,affidavit of indigency

records.addlTxt:
10:34 AM Prosecuting attorney Brian J. Juech appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Colt M Lemmers appeared by phone. 
Court questions the defendant regarding counsel.  Defendant states that he was waiting on paperwork for the court appointed Attorney from the Public Defender's office.  Court notes that he has the correct paperwork.  Defendant didn't realize that he had the correct paperwork.

BY THE COURT:  Reset one more time.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for June 20, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Adjourned initial appearance on June 20, 2022 at 10:00 am.

10:32 AM Defendant Colt M Lemmers appeared by phone.  Attorney Brian Juech appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 
Court questions the defendant regarding an Attorney.  Defendant states that his attorney did not call him back and he does not qualify for Public Defender.  

BY THE COURT:  Court gives the defendant one more chance - reset
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for June 6, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Adjourned initial appearance on June 6, 2022 at 10:00 am.

11:10 AM Defendant Colt M Lemmers appeared by phone.  Attorney Brian Juech appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 
Court questions the defendant.  Defendant hasn't had the money to get an Attorney yet.

BY THE COURT:  Court will give one more chance to get an Attorney
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for May 9, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Adjourned initial appearance on May 9, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Adjourned initial appearance on April 25, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Adjourned initial appearance on March 28, 2022 at 10:00 am.
*Appear for booking within 30 days to the Marquette County Jail  *No operation of a motor vehicle without a valid drivers license    **Bond to be signed and returned to the COC office within 14 days

10:48 AM Defendant Colt M Lemmers appeared by phone means.  Attorney Brian Juech appeared by video means for Plaintiff State of Wisconsin.
  Defendant received a copy of the criminal complaint and asks that the complaint be read.    Court advises defendant of maximum penalties.  Defendant understands.    Court confirms address and phone.
  Court advises defendant of right to an attorney.  Defendant understands and wants to get Public Defender appointment.  Court gives the number.  

  Atty Juech has no objection to a signature bond with conditions.

  BY THE COURT:  Court sets a $500 Signature bond with conditions:
*Appear for booking within 30 days to the Marquette County Jail
*No operation of a motor vehicle without a valid drivers license
  **Bond to be signed and returned to the COC office within 14 days  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for March 28, 2022 at 10:00 am.
